wikipedia_page.main: Peter Fairfield Harvey (15 January 1923 – 19 July 2006) was an English cricketer active from 1947 to 1958 who played for Nottinghamshire. He was born in Linby, Nottinghamshire and died in Oadby, Leicestershire. He appeared in 175 first-class matches as a righthanded batsman who bowled leg break and googly. He scored 3,645 runs with a highest score of 150 among two centuries and took 335 wickets with a best performance of eight for 122.
